trial_identification.studytitle: Respiratory management of acute cervical spinal cord injury with non-invasive ventilation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Cervical spinal cord injured patients American spinal injuries association (ASIA) classification A, B or C complete. Respiratory management with prophylactic non invasive ventilation compared to standard respiratory management. Intensive care unit length of stay outcome.

interventions.interventions: Acute cervical spinal cord injury ASIA A, B and C managed with prophylactic non invasive ventilation over the first 120 hours since onset of injury.
interventions.comparator: Standard respiratory management over the first 120 hours since admission.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Vital capacity measured by calibrated wrights spirometer in supine, best of three attempts.
Length of stay in intensive care unit (ICU)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Eligibility to be discharged from ICU to spinal ward

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Acute cervical spinal cord injury ASIA A, B or C.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: -admit to spinal centre >24 hours post injury -surgical management of cervical spine injury elsewhere -total brain injury -unable to provide consent -non invasive ventilation contraindicated -ventilated on arrival to primary spinal centre.

trial_design.concealment: -all admitted patients screened for eligibility. -allocated to treatment or control via sequentially numbered, opaque sealed envelopes by a person not directly invoved in trial
trial_design.sequence: random numbers used to generate allocation
